text: A beautiful huge sycamore tree at the top of a hill somew outside Seattle, in one of the computer suburbs near Redm A moving truck is coming up the hill, followed by an SUV.

The moving truck pulls up in front of a very pleasant hou with a neat, manicured front lawn and some pretty flowers It’s one of the larger houses on the street. BRYCE LOSKI, 8, gets out of the passenger side of the mov van. He’s already handsome for good. His father RICK gets out of the driver’s side. Bryce and his father dress similarly. The SUV pulls into the driveway and Rick’s wife PATSY LOS and their daughter LYNETTA, 12, get out. Patsy is trim, blond, cheerful, pert, the kind of woman who is always a little too pulled-together.
The four Loskis walk up the front walkway to their new ho and stand there staring at it. Then Bryce turns to look a the house across the street and we hear:
The first day I met Bryce Loski, I flipped.
In the upper window we see JULI BAKER, 8, looking out the window across the street. She’s a tomboy, freckled, adorable.
Honestly, one look at him and I became a lunatic. She throws open the window and shouts across the street.

Hi! The Loski family turns to look at the Baker house across street.  flippedldmay21 2. It’s one of the smaller houses on the street, and it’s as eccentric a house as the Loski house is conventional. It’ not exactly ramshackle, but the lawn needs cutting, there Santa Claus on the roof, there are several whirligigs in front yard and an old Toyota in the driveway. The climbin rose needs pruning. A dog is sitting on the front porch a he wakes up and barks in a kind of half-assed way as Juli throws open the window.
(shouting) Hey, hi. I’m Juli Baker!
Bryce, how nice. I think she’s exactly your age.
(up to Juli, re: Bryce) I’m Lynetta. This is my brother Bryce. Say hi, peabrain.
Lynetta, zip it.
Welcome to the neighborhood! It’s a great neighborhood! You'll love it! On Bryce:
(voice over) All I ever wanted was for Juli Baker to leave me alone.
I’1l be right down! Juli slams the window shut. Rick Loski is looking at the Baker house, at the Christma decorations on the roof.
What are we going to do about those Christmas decorations?
I thought you liked the Christmas decorations.  flippedldmay21 3.
When we bought the house it was Christmas. I had no idea they kept them up all year. Rick starts toward the moving van.
How are we ever going to sell this house if the house across the street has Christmas decorations all year?
We’re not selling this house. We just bought it.
Bryce and his father are in the moving van, unloading box Juli pops up. She’s carrying her soccer ball.
Here I am. I love moving.
Who loves moving?
I’m great at moving.
I found out later she’s great at everything. Absolutely everything. She climbs in, agile as a monkey and begins moving boxes.
Hey, those are valuable.
Rick deposits Juli out of the truck and onto the ground.
Your mom’s probably wondering where you are.
She knows where I am.  flippedldmay21 4. She picks up her soccer ball, kicks it elaborately in the air, drops it on the back of her foot, flips it back up i the air and catches it.

(to Bryce) I have two older brothers, Matt and Mike, who look like twins. They have no interest in kids our age. If they seem like they’re interested in you, they’re not, they just want to torture you. Some day you'll be grateful to me for this tip.
How was I going to get rid of this girl?
(to Bryce) Bryce, isn’t it time for you to help your mother?
Sure thing. Bryce jumps off the truck.

I couldn’t believe it. Dad to the rescue. He didn’t like her either. I mean, what a show-off. And my own dad was putting the ditch play in motion. Bryce starts toward the front door of his house. But Juli follows.
It was weird. I started to follow him --
I heard her coming after me but I couldn't believe it -- Bryce looks over his shoulder, sees Juli just behind him.
I guess you’d have to say I was chasing him up the walkway --  flippedldmay21 5.
Maybe it just sounded like she was chasing me, I mean, she couldn’t be chasing me, could she? Why would she be chasing me?
I was just trying to stop him so maybe we could play a little before he got trapped inside --
-- and she blasted right past me grabbing my arm -- Juli passes Bryce, grabs his arm and stops him.
-- and the next thing I know he’s holding my hand, looking right into my eyes -- Hold on them. On Bryce, looking at Juli. On Juli, looking at Bryce.
My heart stopped. It just stopped beating. I mean, his eyes.
I tried to shake her off, but she just clamped on tight.
They were gorgeous. And they were staring straight at me.
She looked so sappy I couldn’t believe it.
I almost got my first kiss that day, I was sure of it.
If my mother hadn’t come out of the door at that moment --  flippedldmay21 6.
If his mother hadn’t come out there’s just no telling what might have happened -- Bryce’s mother comes out the front door and looks at the of them.
Well, I see you’ve met my son. Bryce untangles himself and shoots straight into the hous
Bryce is now 12 years old. He’s mowing the lawn, sitting the very latest version of an electric lawn mower.

It’s four years later, and guess what? Nothing’s changed. The only real difference is that Grandma died, mom’s mom, so Grandpa moved in. We see the front porch of the Loski house. Sitting on it CHET DUNCAN, Patsy Loski’s father, a man in his early seventies. On the table next to him is a Tom Clancy book a copy of the newspaper, but Chet isn’t reading, he’s jus sitting there. We see the Baker house. It’s slightly shabbier than it wa and there are more Christmas decorations. The grass is longer than ever.
And meanwhile I’ve still got my own personal stalker -- Up in the Baker window we see Juli, who’s now 12 too. She looks out the window at Bryce, who’s mowing the lawn.

Hey, Bryce! Good work! Bryce goes on mowing.  flippedldmay21 7. Juli’s father ROBERT BAKER pulls his battered pick-up tru into the driveway. A painted sign on the side of the truc says Robert Baker, general contractor. MATT and MIKE, Jul older brothers, who are both 16 but not twins, get out of truck with their father and start into the house.
My dad had this idea that if we did a really great job on our front lawn it might inspire the Bakers to clean up their yard, but guess what, it didn’t.
Dinner everybody! Bryce turns off the mower and starts into the house, past grandfather.
The Loski family is at the dinner table. Food is being passed. Lynetta, now 16, lots of eye makeup, takes a tiny portion. Bryce helps himself. Rick is eating spaghetti. N Grandpa.
Is that all you’re eating, Lynetta?
Could be. She breaks up a tiny piece of a pasta strand and puts it her mouth, chews it slowly.
(calling to her grandfather who’s still outside) Dad? Dinner?
I think he heard you.
Maybe he’s not hungry. Rick and Patsy exchange a look.
Don’t say it, Rick.  flippedldmay21 8.
Don’t say what? Patsy goes to the front door.
Dad? Come on. You gotta eat. Her father shakes his head no.
Bryce in bed. Lights are out. On Bryce, listening through the wall to a barely-audible fight between his parents.
Look, he’s heartbroken.
He should be living with people in the same situation --
I am not sending him to a home --
He hates me.
He doesn’t hate you. Hold on Bryce, listening.
As Bryce comes out the door. His grandfather is sitting in the chair, rocking.
Morning, grandpa. His grandfather doesn’t answer. Bryce starts down the block.  flippedldmay21 9.

The huge sycamore tree at the top of the hill. About EIGHT KIDS are standing under it, waiting for the school bus. Bryce joins them. A beat. Four of the kids ar girls, including SHELLY STALLS, another seventh grader wh hanging around with her friends. They’re all in tank tops and jeans, and lots of accessories. Most of them are wear I-Pods.
Hi Bryce.
Hi Shelly.
Hi Bryce.
The bus is three blocks away! Everyone looks up. Juli is sitting about halfway up the sycamore tree. She can see the road.

Two and a half! Everyone stares at each other and shrugs. Typical Juli. Juli starts to shimmy down the tree. There’s a spiral sli halfway down and Juli puts her arms out into the air as i she’s flying. She lands on the ground just as the bus is block away.

(to the group) Here’s the thing about sycamore trees, you almost never find them all bunched up together. They are individual. They do not need company. The bus stops and everyone starts to get into it.
Bryce sits down in the bus with his friend GARRETT. Juli sits right in front of him, with her friend DARLA.  On Bryce, She hands flippedidmay21 10.
Hey, Jules --
Hey, Darla. Bryce, do you realize that tree could be a hundred years old easily? Which means it could practically be the oldest thing in this entire town.
Here’s the deal. I always tried to ignore Juli, but she always ended up sucking me in.
It could be two hundred years old.
I seriously doubt that.
Well it could. determined to ignore Juli.
(continued) It could.
That tree is an ugly mutant tangle of gnarly branches.
Bryce Loski, how can you say that about a tree?
He can’t help it. He’s visually challenged. (she pulls a sycamore leaf out of her notebook) A lot of people confuse the sycamore leaf with a maple but it’s not. the leaf to Bryce.
Keep it.  flippedidmay21 11.
In front of the class is the teacher, MISS BRUBECK.
The science fair is in six weeks -- Juli is sitting behind Bryce. Every so often Juli leans forward and takes a sniff of Bryce’s hair.
-- and good science projects take time. Shelly Smalls looks over at Juli leaning forward to sniff Bryce.
Here’s something I forgot to mention. On top of everything else, she liked to sniff me --
His hair smelled like watermelon --
And she thought I didn’t know she was doing it --

So I would just lean over very subtly, and I swear to God he never even knew I was taking a whiff -- Juli notices at Shelly Stalls is staring at her. She stop sniffing Bryce’s hair. Shelly smirks at her and rolls her eyes at her friend MIRANDA.
Shelly, do you have some problem with the science project?
No, Miss Brubeck.
So please have your projects in mind by next Monday. The bells rings.  flippedidmay21 12. Shelly looks back at Juli.
You know what you should do your project on? Obsession. She stands up to leave.
Everyone is filing out of the room. Juli is gathering up things.
Do you have a science project, Juli?
No. But I will.
Of course you will.
Although I wish I knew what it was.
I have a friend who has chickens. I could get you fertilized eggs, and you could hatch them --
What if they die?
Well if you document it, you’1l still get an A, if that’s what you care about.
I don’t care about getting an A. Miss Brubeck looks at her.
Okay I do. Miss Brubeck smiles at her.  flippedidmay21 13.
Juli’s mother TRINA is cooking dinner. She’s tall and pretty, wearing jeans and a pullover sweater. Juli is mak a salad, which she puts on the table. As Mike, Matt and Robert come into the kitchen:
I might hatch chickens for the science project. Miss Brubeck can get me eggs --
Why don’t you just grow beans?
That's like a third-grade thing.
Make a volcano.
Volcano, dude.
Volcanos are so lame. They are so “poy” .
I could help you make an incubator.
You could?
Something smells funny in here. Do you smell something funny?
Nope.
Dinner. Rick, Patsy, Lynetta, Bryce and Patsy’s father Ch Chet is not saying anything.
Whatever I do I am not doing the volcano thing.  flippedidmay21 14.
Why don’t you do plants?
Plants?
You plant two sets of plants and one of them you talk to and the other one you don’t talk to and then you see which one grows more.
Oh sure. Me talking to plants.
What’s wrong with the volcano thing?
It is so lame.
There are six eggs in a hygrometer, labeled Abby, Bonnie, Clyde, Dexter, Eunice and Florence. Juli is watching her father paint a landscape. The baseme is filled with painter’s supplies.

A painting is all about light. of course, it’s also about composition, and about whatever you’re painting, but it’s the light that makes a painting more than the sum of its parts -- On Robert, painting. His brush dips into the oil paints a onto the canvas, dappling light into the landscape.
Lynetta is getting ready to go to school, Rick is pouring coffee, Patsy reading the paper, Bryce eating breakfast.
Okay. Here’s another idea. You put celery in red ink.  flippedidmay21 15.
Which proves what?
(as to an idiot) The ink turns the celery red, proving that a plant sucks up moisture. It’s like putting a flower in water.
So why not just put a flower in water?
Why I bother helping you I will never know. I know, build a computer.
What’s the Baker girl doing?
She is hatching eggs.
That girl loves to grandstand.
Juli’s father holds one of Juli’s eggs up to a cardboard and aims a flashlight at it.
People used to use candles to do this. Look. You can see the embryo. Juli looks. We can see the embryo.
See the dark spot in the middle? With all the veins leading to it? We see it. It’s pulsing.
Oh my God! (shouting upstairs) Everybody! Wait till you see this!  flippedidmay21 16.
All the Bakers are looking at the eggs.
Bonnie’s heart is beating.
Congratulations. You’re a mother. Trina starts up the stairs, followed by Matt and Mike.
I still smell that smell.
As Trina, Matt and Mike come into the living room. Their dog, CHAMP, is peeing on the end table leg.
Champ, what are you doing? I knew it. I just knew it. The Mystery Smell comes from the Mystery Pisser. Did you see that? Robert and Juli come up the stairs. Robert goes over to look.
It’s barely a drop.
Exactly. Which is why I’ve never been able to find anything. That dog stays outside from now on.
Mystery Pisser.
Cool name. They high-five each other.

A beautiful blue kite is flying in the sky.  flippedidmay21 17. Juli and Darla walk home from school. They’re kicking a soccer ball down the block. When they get to Darla’s hous Darla peels off, with the soccer ball. Julie continues on, and looks up to see the kite. It crashes into the top of the sycamore tree. On Juli, looking up at the tree.

I always knew the sycamore tree was the greatest tree ever. It hada built-in slide, almost a complete spiral, and it was great to ride it down. But I’d never been to the top until the day the kite got caught up there. Juli starts to climb the tree. Inside the tree, as she gets higher and higher. She looks up and there’s the kite, flashing through the branches. She looks down and realizes she’s way up in the tree. Now she looks out and sees Bryce. He’s looking up at the tree.
And then it turned out to be Bryce’s kite.
Hey, you don’t have to get that --
I can get it --
It's too high, you'll fall --
I can get it -- She shinnies up higher. She looks around. Higher than she ever been.  flippedidmay21 18.
Hey, it’s okay, I can get another kite. Juli, you're making me nervous. Juli gulps.
No problem. She reaches out for the kite. But the string is tangled. She untangles it. For a moment she almost loses her balan

Break the string! Juli reaches out to break the string and grabs the kite. And suddenly she’s on top of the tree, looking out. Juli’S POV: The view is heart-stopping. A gorgeous sky in blues and violets, fluffy clouds she could float away on, sunlight dappling the tree-tops and roofs. ON JULIANA, on top of the tree turning her head to see th world from every angle. The light changes every which way she looks. WIDE SHOT: A young girl at the top of a giant sycamore tr CLOSE ON Juli: elated.
Are you okay? Juli awakens from her reverie, and starts down the tree.
As Juli lands on the earth, holding the kite. She hands i to Bryce.
Thanks.
I was on top of the world. You should have seen it. You should have seen the light. She turns and starts home, with Champ.  flippedidmay21 19.
Juli dances around her father as he gets out of the truck heads into the house.
I was up so high and I wasn’t afraid. I felt like I was flying.
The Baker family is making dinner.
Everything sparkled, like it had just been washed. And I could smell the breeze, it smelled like sunshine --
As her father paints and Juli works on her egg chart.
I totally understood what you meant about the sum of the parts. Dad, you’ve got to do it, you've got to climb the tree.
I think my tree-climbing days are over. There’s a noise. A little noise. Juli looks into the incubator. One of the eggs is starting to hatch.
Yow! Look at this! Can you believe this!!!  Everyone!!!!
My friend, there is not a lot to incubating eggs. You’ve got your light, you’ve got your container, you've got some shredded newspaper, and that’s it. (continued)  flippedidmay21 20.
As Bryce, with his parents, walks in carrying a large cardboard tray with a mound of sand piled onto it. This i volcano.

But not Juli. It’s a miracle she didn’t turn up at the science fair in a chicken suit. At least six other boys have also made volcanos. One of t boys lights a match. The top of his volcano starts to sputter. Imitation lava flows down the side. No one is looking at that volcano or at Bryce. Nor are they looking at Shelly Stalls’ science project, w is a study of how long lipstick stays on your mouth, in comparison to lip gloss. There are fifteen large photogra of Shelly's lips. Shelly stands there.
Hi, Bryce. She puckers her lips at him. But Bryce is looking over at a crowd of people. They’re looking at Juli and her incubator. Tiny fuzzy chi and two little eggs cracking open ...
Listen to this, she actually Managed to time it so the last two eggs hatched during the fair. A baby chick emerges from the shell. THE ENTIRE GROUP OF SPECTATORS: AWWWWWWWW.
How does a person do that?
Juli stands on stage in front of a row of judges. She has her incubator and a huge bulletin board with photos and diagrams. She has a laser pointer.  flippedidmay21 21.

(with disdain) And yes that is a laser pointer. To light this diagram or that part of the incubator or this section of the chart and talk about how unbelievably exciting -- Bryce, eyes narrowed, watches...
(to the judges) It was unbelievably exciting --
-- it was to watch eggs grow for twenty-one days. ON THE AUDIENCE, watching. Juli’s parents and Matt and Mi so proud. Juli’s friend Darla watching too.
And guess what? The audience bursts into applause.
As Mrs. Brubeck pins a blue ribbon on Juli.
That's right. She won first prize.
And I want to thank mom who is such a great supporter, my amazing Dad, who helped me build the incubator, and my brothers who did nothing -- The audience laughs. On Bryce, not laughing.
Bryce is carrying his volcano out of the school. comes up to him.
Your lava was great, Bryce -- Shelly  flippedidmay21 22. Bryce tosses the volcano into a dumpster.
Juli comes outside. Darla is helping her carry the incubator. Everyone congratulates Juli. Her parents and brothers are waiting.
But those go back to Mrs. Brubeck, right?
Are you kidding me?
They’re coming home?
Where else would they go?
Darla could take them.
My mom would kill me. DARLA’S MOM appears. DARLA’S MOM I would. I would kill her.
As they get out of the van and walk into the house.
But where are we going to raise chickens?
In the yard. They’re very low maintenance. They eat bugs. The family goes into the house.
So that’s how we wound up with chickens. (continued)  flippedidmay21 23.

head_text.subj: HOLD ON THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE

text: Six chickens in the front yard.

But what none of us thought of was that six chickens scratching for bugs not only gets rid of bugs, it also tears up grass. So pretty soon there was nothing whatsoever left of our yard. (continued) We see there’s almost no grass left in the yard. Across the street, we see Bryce, mowing the perfect Loski lawn.
And I’m sorry to say this, but chicken feed attracts mice. (continued) We see Matt and Mike, setting out some very simple mousetraps.
So my brothers decided, as long as we've got mice, might as well get a snake. Snakes love mice.
As Trina Baker goes up the stairs. Hold on the stairs as hear her open the door to Matt and Mike’s room. She screa
What is a snake doing in this house? Were you planning to tell me about this?
The snake is now living in a large aquarium in the garage Matt, Mike and Robert are showing it to Trina.  flippedidmay21 24.
Trina, it will be fine. Boa constrictors are really no trouble at all.
Trina is working at her computer as Juli comes into the r
Mom, guess what? She holds out her palms. Eggs.
No. Honey, no. No more chickens, please I can’t take this.
Not chickens, eggs. Just eggs.
Eggs.

head_text.subj: AN EGG, CRACKING INTO A BOWL.

text: Cracking into a bowl. A PLATE OF SCRAMBLED EGGS ... It's passed around the table, everyone oohing and ahhing about how great they taste.
There is nothing in the world like a fresh egg.
Robert pops one into his mouth.
These are as good as my mother’s devilled eggs.  flippedldmay21 25.
As Robert heaps egg salad onto his plate.
Love egg salad. Love it.

Good thing you do. AN EGG IN SOMEONE’S HAND ... INT. SKYLER BROWN’S GARAGE - ANOTHER DAY There’s a lot of rock and roll stuff -- guitars, drums, amplifiers and an upright piano. Lynetta stands in the garage with an egg in her hand. Ona table is the boa constrictor. Next to her is her boyfrien SKYLER BROWNE. A group of friends, including Juli’s brothers Matt and Mike watch. Skyler steps up next to Lynetta.
To the riddle of which comes first, we have an answer. The egg comes first. Lynetta waves the egg theatrically in the air. Bryce comes into the garage, looking for Lynetta. Matt sp him.
Bryce, my man, just in time for the Skyler and Lynetta Show.
(to Lynetta) Mom wants you.
Give the baby bro a front row seat. Come on, don’t be shy, step right up ... ON BRYCE, shoved into the front. Bryce’s mouth gapes open when he sees the snake.  flippedidmay21 26.

Lynetta, the egg please. Lynetta holds up the egg as if she’s the magician’s helpe displays it this way and that, locks lips with Skyler and then hands the egg over to him. Skyler hands the egg to Mike.

Here’s where I come in. (to the snake) Ready? ON BRYCE WATCHING as ... Mike gives the egg to the snake, which opens its mouth wi and ingests the egg whole. WE CAN SEE THE EGG IN THE BOA’ NECK. ON BRYCE, FREAKED. AND THEN THE BOA SWALLOWS A SECOND EGG. AND THEN A THIRD EGG. On Bryce, completely disgusted.
So Brycie boy, how is he going to digest this? He needs a tree or a leg. (leaning in close) Want to volunteer yours? Everyone laughs. Mike releases the snake to the floor.
Aww, too bad. He’s got another idea. He’s going to use the piano instead. The snake slithers over and wraps itself around the piano leg.
Shhh, everyone, here goes. Everyone watches. The snake stops moving, then flexes. THE SOUND of the egg crunching inside.  flippedidmay21 27.
(theatrically) Dinner is served. CRUNCH CRUNCH CRUNCH.
Bryce and Lynetta walking home.
So sick.
So cool --
I’m never eating an egg again. THE SOUND OF A DOORBELL RINGING.
As Bryce opens the door. Juli is standing there with a ha carton of eggs.
You know my chickens? From the science fair?
(how could I forget them) Yeah.
So these are for you and your family. She hands him the eggs.
Oh. Thanks.

The half-carton of eggs is on the table. Everyone is havi a kind of informal breakfast -- Bryce, Lynetta (whose mak from the night before is sort of running from her eyes), Patsy, Rick and Chet. Chet is reading the newspaper.  flippedidmay21 28.
Scrambled? Fried?
I’m having cereal.
More coffee dad? Chet barely responds. Patsy pours more coffee in his cup.
(back to Bryce and the eggs ) What about soft-boiled?
Bryce is never eating another egg. Because of the snake --
What snake?
(as if it’s common knowledge) There's a snake living across the street at the Bakers’, a boa constrictor --
Across the street? Living across the street?
-- he’s kind of the mascot for the guys’ band. Mystery Pisser.
That’s the name of the snake?
That’s the name of the band.
What kind of parents would let their children name a band something like that? It’s vile.  flippedidmay21 29.

Their house is worth more because they’re across the street from us and our house is worth less because we're across the street from them. They all look at the carton of eggs. Patsy picks one up, turns it around.
What if you cracked it open and there was a chick in it?
Ewwww. She puts it back into the carton. He shrugs.
I’m having cereal.

To be perfectly honest, I’ve never been entirely sure how an egg gets fertilized. (he laughs) I know I should know. I know roosters have to be involved. Birds do it, bees do it, but how do they do it?
Do they have sex with the hens?
Well they must. A pause at the table. A beat.
They must. Chet looks up from his newspaper.

As with all birds, there has to be mating for fertilization to occur. (continued)  flippedidmay21 30. Chet is speaking. Everyone is riveted. CHET (CONT’D) Although it’s not particularly romantic. The rooster picks a hen, usually on the basis of proximity, grabs her by the back of the head, climbs on her back, and you can pretty much figure out the rest. The whole thing takes about 15 seconds give or take, and as far as anyone can tell, the only satisfying thing about the encounter as far as the hen is concerned is that afterwards she fluffs up her feathers. (beat) In any case, there are no roosters at the Bakers, I will swear to it. If there were roosters, we would know. You can hear roosters.
Cock a doodle doo.
Exactly.
(so pleased that he’s finally said something) Grandpa! Chet goes back to his newspaper.
I’m having seconds on cereal.
Well it’s easy to find out if there are roosters. Just ask Lynetta to ask Juli’s brothers.
What are their names again?
Matt and Mike. Or get Lynetta to get Skyler to ask them.
Shut up, Bryce.  flippedidmay21 31.
What did I do now?
Haven't you noticed I haven't been going down there, jerk?
Since when?
Since yesterday. Lynetta burst into tears.
Did something happen with you and Skyler?
Like you care. She leaves the room.
Oh boy.
Rick and Bryce are putting golf balls. Chet is on the bac porch.
Why don’t you just ask Juli Baker?
I’m not asking her anything.
(from the porch) They have no rooster.
Just ask her.

As Bryce and his friend GARRETT come down the back alley the fence behind the Baker house. They look over it.  flippedidmay21 32. A mess. Much worse than the front yard. There’s a makeshi chicken coop and a few old pieces of lawn furniture. Cham the dog is asleep.

Juli opens the back door and comes out of the house. She’ carrying a basket to gather eggs. Garrett and Bryce duck down behind the fence. As Juli gets down on her hands and knees and dives into t chicken coop. The hens fly out of it.
No rooster.
Correctomundo.
Back at the dinner table.
Anyway, you guys can eat the eggs, but there’s no way I’m going to touch them, so don’t even ask.
Why’s that?
There’s poop all over the place.
Gross.
Chicken turds everywhere. Lynetta stands up and leaves the table.
You expect me to eat after this?
Lynetta. You have to eat something.  flippedidmay21 33.
No I don’t! She leaves the room and sticks her head back in.
Does the word salmonella mean anything to you? She splits again.
Do you think the eggs could have salmonella?
They're probably packed with it. One bite -- (he grabs his neck and pretends to gag to death)
I can’t believe you didn’t just ask her. You are afraid of that girl.
She just bugs me. She bugs you too.
Just take back the eggs and tell them we don’t eat eggs. Tell her we're allergic to them, or something.
Well that would be a lie. You want him to lie?
That’s not the point. The point is, he spies on someone’s yard instead of asking a simple question. On Chet, looking at Rick. Clearly he thinks Rick is bully Bryce.
(to Chet) What is it?  flippedidmay21 34.
Nothing. Chet looks back down at his plate.
(back to Bryce) Just tell her, no eggs. I expect you to look that girl square in the eye. DOORBELL RINGS.
So this is me, looking her square in the eye. Bryce opens the door for Juli. She hands him some eggs. He can hardly look at her.
And this is me, telling her “No Eggs.”
Thanks, Juli. He closes the door. On Bryce. Mortified. He turns around and we hold on him with his back to the door, holding the eggs. Now what? We hear his parents’ door open upstairs.
I’1l be back about six. As his father starts downstairs, Bryce quickly goes into:
He opens the door to the trash below the sink, stuffs the eggs into it.
See there were so many eggs that I had to give them away. (MORE )
flippedldmay21 35. JULI (V.0O.) (cont'd) To the Loskis, and to our our next door neighbor Mrs. Stueby --
As Juli brings her some eggs.
Who started paying me for them. Two dollars a dozen.
Nothing like free-range eggs.
And then Mrs. Stueby told Mrs. Helms --
As Juli drops eggs off to MRS. HELMS, who also pays her.
As Juli crosses the street.
And when I brought the eggs to the Loskis, it was so great -- As Bryce throws open the door again.
Because it was like Bryce was looking forward to me coming.
I dreaded it --
And he always said, “Thanks, Juli” -
Thanks, Juli.
-- Like he really really meant it --  flippedidmay21 36.
I sounded so fake I couldn’t believe it --
The best, shiniest eggs went straight to the Loskis, and in return I got a few moments alone with the world’s most dazzling eyes.
I could hardly even look at her.
More eggs being stuffed into the wastebasket.
Juli, wearing her school backpack, comes out of her house with some eggs.

And then something happened that changed everything and it had nothing to do with eggs. (continued) EXT. STREET —- DAY A gorgeous day. Juli walks toward the sycamore tree and t bus stop, where several kids are waiting for the bus.

And it happened on the most beautiful day, which just goes to show you that terrible things can happen when you least expect them -- She drops her backpack, jumps onto the lowest branch and climbs up.
As Juli climbs through the highest branches to her perch the very top. JULI’S VIEW - GLORIOUS.  flippedidmay21 37. On Juli, savoring the morning, the sunlight, the breeze.
Darla’s at the base of the tree, as well as Shelly Stalls There’s a slightly dorky boy, JON TRULOCK.
What a morning!
Bryce and Garrett and a couple of other kids walk down th street to the bus stop.

The sun is sending streaks of fire from one end of the world to another! Bryce and the other kids look at each other. Typical Juli Suddenly two big trucks pull into the bus stop, and FOUR WORKMEN get out.
You can’t park there, that’s the bus stop --
Sure we can.
Hey, that’s the bus stop -- The workmen look up at the tree.
Is someone up there?
Who’s up there?
Juli Baker.
(shouting down) -- So move your truck.  flippedidmay21 38.
Is she crazy?
No.
Yes, actually she is.
Well, this tree’s coming down, so she’s got to get out of it.
The tree’s coming down? What do you mean the tree’s coming down?
I mean the tree’s coming down. (calling up to Juli) Hey, girl. You gotta come down from there.
How did she get up there?
She climbed.
Juli, they’re tearing down the tree!
They’re serious! Two workmen take chain saws out of the truck. ON Juli, on top of the tree ...
(shock) This tree? The sycamore tree?
Yeah, whatever, it’s going. Come on down.
They have chain saws.
Huge ones.  flippedidmay21 39.
(shouting down) Who said you could? Who gave you permission?
(shouting back) The owner, that’s who.
(also shouting up) The owner.
(shouting down) He has no right!
(shouting up) He’s building himself a house and he can’t very well do it with this tree in the way. Now, come down from there, we got work to do.
(shouting up) The owner’s the owner. In the distance, the school bus is coming.
Bus is coming.
Juli, the bus is coming.
No. No, I won’t. You can’t cut it down, you just can’t! This tree is a historical landmark! On the workmen, looking at each other, what is going on?
She loves the tree.
Spare me.
She’s bananas.
flippedidmay21 40.
(calling) Come down from there.
No!
(to the workman) Can I speak to you privately?
No.
(quietly) If you cut down the tree, it’1l be like cutting out her heart. That tree is, like, 200 years old.
Your girlfriend’s a nut.
She’s not my girlfriend --
(shouting up to Juli) I’‘1l call the police. Do you want me to call the police?
(shouting back) I don’t care!
I’m calling them. We've got papers here -- (he waves them)
(shouting to Juli) They have papers. They’re going to arrest you. It’s going to go on your college application.
I’m not coming down from this tree! I’m never coming down! as the school bus arrives.  flippedidmay21 41.
You’re going to have to cut me down ! All the kids waving at her to come down: Juli, come down, Juli, please, you’re going to get in trouble.
Juli, they mean it. Come down.
(calling to her friends) No, you come up! All of you! Darla, everybody! If we’re all up here they can’t cut it down! ON THE KIDS, looking up at her. Jon Trulock is clearly to
Juli, I can’t climb that tree --
Me either.
(pleading) You don’t have to climb this high. Just a little ways. Haven’t you ever heard of civil disobedience? The BUS DRIVER gets out of the school bus.
Are we going to school or what? A couple of the kids start toward the bus. Darla is stricken. Bryce is torn.
Please. Please. Oh man -- One by one, the kids get on the bus. Bryce is last.

Bryce, please, if you just come up here, we can save it -- Bryce gets on the bus. The bus takes off.  flippedidmay21 42. Juli, on top of the tree, watches the bus pull away. Workman #1 takes out a cell phone to call the police.

Chet Duncan is sitting on the front porch, reading the pa We hear the sound of a siren. Chet looks up. As he does, two police cars pass, then a fire engine. Chet stands. A LOCAL NEWS TRUCK passes. Chet walks out to the street and starts walking. As he walks, Trina hurries past him.
Chet among a crowd of neighbors, firemen, newsmen, news trucks, the workmen. Trina is on her cellphone, trying to reach her husband.
(to Rob’s message) I can’t believe you're not answering. Call me when you get this message.
Robert Baker is supervising as raw wood is being loaded i his pickup. The sound of a buzz saw cutting planks drowns out the sound of his cell phone.
Some workmen and firemen are attempting to reason with Tr
It's something that my daughter feels very strongly about.  flippedidmay21 43.
(shouting down) I’m not coming down, Mom!
(shouting back) That’s what I told them. ON JULI, in the tree. SUN GRADUALLY SHINES EVEN MORE BRIGHTLY as we head toward noon.
It’s been three hours, and Juli Baker is still up in that tree, refusing to come down.

A truck pulls up, delivering pizza. The crowd is bigger. Chet is still there, as is Trina. A florid man in an expensive suit -- the OWNER of the property -- gets out and begins conferring with police. LONG SHOT OF JULI, fierce and brave and defiant, at the t of the sycamore. Trina, once again on the cellphone.
Where are you?
Rob, having unloaded the lumber, is talking to a mason at construction job he’s supervising. There’s a small cement mixer that drowns out the ring of the cellphone.

Rob drives the pickup truck on a two-lane highway. He tur on the radio. MATT’S VOICE (ON RADIO) Our sister’s impossible. MIKE’S VOICE (ON RADIO) Stubborn.  flippedidmay21 44. MATT’S VOICE (ON RADIO) A nightmare. MIKE’S VOICE (ON RADIO) But we back her a thousand per cent! On Robert. What?
As of now, Juli Baker has been at the top of the sycamore tree for six hours -- On Robert, floored. He makes a U-turn.
The crowd is larger. Matt and Mike continue to give interviews to anyone who’s interested. Maybe Mike mention their band, Mystery Pisser. There’s a ice cream truck. Ch is eating an Eskimo pie.
Juli sits defiantly on top of the tree. She’s adjusted he position so she’s very comfortable, straddling a large branch, leaning back against the trunk.
Robert Baker pulls up in his pickup truck. He looks up at the tree. There’s Juli. She sees him. On Juli, in the tree. She looks down. She sees him.
Dad! They want to tear down the tree!
(calling up to her) So I hear. Several newscasters attempt to waylay him, but Robert ign them. He puts his arm around his wife and they begin conferring with the Police Chief.  flippedidmay21 45.
If they’re taking this tree, they’re taking me with it!

There’s a huge cherry picker next to the tree and the che picker-operator is guiding the top of the vehicle. EXT. TOP OF THE TREE —- CONTINUOUS Robert Baker is up in the cherry picker, talking to Juli, who’s eating a sandwich he’s apparently brought up with h Chet watches from below.
It’s not your tree, honey --
It’s everyone's tree.

Well unfortunately it’s not. It’s that guy’s tree. The one with the red face, who’s jumping up and down like Rumpelstilskin -- Looking down at the crowd looking up into the tree, we se the owner, who looks furious.
And judging from my recent introduction to him, the environment is not at the top of his list of priorities --
Look at this view. No one’s ever going to see this view if he cuts down the tree -- Robert nods. A beat.
I know. I’m in complete agreement with you. A beat.  flippedidmay21 46.
But what?
But what if you’re still up here in the middle of the night, and you fell asleep and fell out of the tree? Juli and her father looking at one another.

No view is worth my little girl’s safety. Another beat. The sun is starting to set. And then Juli suddenly vanishes. She slides down the tree for the last time. She comes down the spiral slide and holds out her arms as she’s flying.
She lands.

head_text.subj: ON JULI, A FEW MINUTES LATER,

text: speaking to a television news reporter with a cameraman.

I just believe that the tree belongs to all of us. When something is that old and that beautiful and everyone respects it and expects to wake up in the morning and see it every single day, then it’s not just one person’s tree, it’s everyone’s tree. ON Chet, watching her.
Juli gets into the truck with her father.  flippedidmay21 47. They drive away.
We hear the first chain saw start to buzz. Juli bursts into tears.
Hey, hey. He pulls over. He tucks his hand under her chin so she looks at him. Tea stream down her face.
I’m so proud of you. She buries herself in her father’s arms and sobs her hear out.

head_text.subj: THE BASE OF THE SYCAMORE TREE

text: The tree is mostly gone. Bryce and some friends walk past on the way home from sch The whole landscape has changed.
The entire family is watching the local news.
Just because you own something doesn’t mean it’s not part of what makes a neighborhood a neighborhood As we hear a newsman say: Juli Baker, a young woman who t a stand for what she believes in ...
I’m glad you didn’t get involved in that, Bryce. Bryce feels awful that he didn’t.  flippedidmay21 48.
They're attention-getters. That whole family. Chet stands up and leaves.
(to Patsy) Your father hates me.
He doesn’t hate you, he loves you.
As Chet sits in his rocker, reading the newspaper. Bryce comes outside, sits down next to his grandfather. The two of them sit there.
Did you read this? We see now a picture of Juli on the front page of the newspaper, with a huge picture of the sycamore tree and a headline: A LOCAL GIRL’S FIGHT FOR A SYCAMORE TREE.
I don’t have to read it. I was there.
A girl like that doesn’t live across the street from everyone.
A girl like that is a big mixture of things --

Most people are mixtures of things. (he hands him the newspaper ) Read this. Without prejudice. Bryce takes the newspaper. He’s irritated. He stands goes into the house. up and  flippedidmay21 49. INT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT As Bryce comes into his bedroom carrying the newspaper. H stuffs it into the bottom drawer of his desk. Throws himself on the bed.
On Juli’s window. The curtains are drawn. INT. JULI’S BEDROOM - NIGHT She’s on the bed, weeping.
The two houses opposite each other. A sad, lonely night.
A big hole where the sycamore was. Kids wait for the bus. Juli’s not there. The bus pulls up, they get on.
From then on, she refused to ride the bus.
Juli mopes through the halls. She passes Jon Trulock.
I’m really sorry about the tree, Juli. Juli nods. Bryce at a locker, watches.
She stopped charging around, stopped lecturing kids on throwing their trash in the garbage.  flippedidmay21 50. A kid drops garbage in front of her. She steps over it.
Juli stares out the window.
No more slicing the air with her hand, dying to be called on.
Juli eating with Darla. Bryce comes toward her with his tray.
I kept thinking I'd say something, like, Man, sorry about your sycamore, but nothing came out. He walks on by.
Bryce on the bus. Looking out the window, he sees Juli, i rain slicker, pedalling her beat-up bicycle.
Even in the rain, she wouldn’t ride the bus.
Weird, huh.
Juli’s weird. EXT. JULI’S HOUSE - DAY Bryce, outside, mowing the lawn He keeps sneaking looks a Juli’'s window
She even stopped watching my every move. Which was a total relief. CAMERA TRAVELS THOUGH JULI’S WINDOW...  flippedidmay21 51. INT. JULI’S BEDROOM She’s lying on the bed.
As Juli comes out the back door with a basket to collect eggs. Champ is lying on the back porch. Juli leans down to give him a nuzzle. Champ is dead.

Champ is being buried. Robert, Trina, Matt, Mike, Juli an some of their friends. There’s a tombstone that says: “He lies Champ, the Mystery Pisser.” Matt and Mike and Skyler are singing a heavy metal song a Champ, a dog that inspired a great music group. The last spades of dirt are shoveled over the grave. Juli is blowing her nose into a handkerchief. The song ends. Wide shot on:
As Robert pulls up in his truck, gets out. A puppy jumps out of the truck, barking. Trina opens the front door.
Oh, Robert.
Don’t even bother saying no -- They look at each other. No real difference of opinion.  flippedidmay21 52.

Juli, honey, come on down here, I’ve got a surprise -- Hold on a wide shot of the house. The front door is open we see Juli come down the stairs. The puppy leaps into Juli’s arms and starts to lick her f
Juli, carrying a half-carton of eggs, comes up the walkwa with her new dog LUCY. Bryce whips the door open before she rings the bell.
Hi.
Cute dog.
Her name’s Lucy. I know it’s very common but I couldn’t help it. She hands him the eggs.
Thanks. Are you going to start riding the bus again? Juli shrugs. An awkward moment. A beat.
You don’t have to give us these.
I know.
Well. Thanks. He closes the door. Juli sort of stands there.
Bryce walks with the eggs to:  flippedidmay21 53.

The trash can is absolutely full. He tries stuffing the eggs into it. They barely fit. He rummages around and tries to poke them down into it. He pulls out the whole trash bag. Then he walks toward the front door, carrying the trash.
As Bryce comes out the door carrying the trash. We can hear the garbage truck coming up the block. Suddenly Bryce sees Juli. She’s still on the porch, refastening Lucy’s leash.
Hey --

Hey -- He starts down to the street. The trash bag is heavy. He gets to the curb, Juli following. He stuffs the trash bag into the garbage container that’s on the street for the garbage truck pickup. The egg carton pokes out. Juli can see the eggs through the holes in the carton.
Why are you throwing the eggs away? Did you break them?
Yeah and I’m really sorry about that. She opens the carton. All the eggs are there, intact.
Why are you throwing them away?  flippedidmay21 54.
Does the word salmonella mean anything to you?
Salmonella?

My mom doesn’t think it’s worth the risk. The garbage truck arrives in front of the house and empti the trash bags into the back of the truck. Juli is just standing there, stunned, as the noise of the garbage truck makes conversation temporarily impossible. The truck pulls away.
So that’s basically it. Bryce starts back toward his house. Juli follows him. She looks funky.
Salmonella?
Your backyard is like, covered in turds. I mean, look at your place Juli. Just look at it. It’s a complete mess.
It is not.
Oh come on, Juli. Look at it. over at the house. It happens to look particularly
Have you always thrown the eggs away?
Look, we didn’t want to hurt your feelings.  flippedidmay21 55.
My feelings? People pay me for these eggs. They pay me two dollars a dozen --
They do?
Why didn’t you just give them back to me? Why didn’t you just come up with a polite excuse like, we don’t want your stupid eggs. I was just being ... neighborly.

Yeah, well if you really want to be neighborly look at your yard. It’s a freak. People on this block have lawns. Every single house. And you know what? It’s May. Who has Christmas lights all year long?
You don’t like our twinkle lights? Are you nuts? Twinkle lights make you happy. There’s no law that says you have to take them down in January. Downtown Seattle is full of twinkle lights.

(sarcastically) And Santa Clauses, everybody’s got Santa Clauses all year long. (throwing her line back at her) I mean, just because you own something doesn’t mean it’s not part of the neighborhood. You said that yourself, Juli, on TV.
I hate you, Bryce Loski, I absolutely hate you. She turns around walks back over to her house. Lucy the d follows.  flippedidmay21 56.
Through the window, we see Chet watching the two of them. He’s obviously overheard the conversation. As Bryce starts back to the house, he sees Chet watching. Chet vanishes from the window.
I couldn’t believe it. I wasted like four years of my life on Bryce Loski and he turned out to be the worst human being on the planet. (continued)
As Juli walks into it and the door closes. Hold on the fr of the house. It is a mess, no question.
What made me the craziest was that I could sort of see what he was talking about. I mean, not everything. But I could see that someone looking at our house might think it looked sort of shabby ...
Juli is sitting at the table, lost in thought. Everyone e is passing food around.
Your Uncle David is coming again this summer.
How’s Uncle David?
The same. Exactly the same.
Top of the Space Needle --  flippedidmay21 57.
Man, I never saw anyone made so happy by a Space Needle. Juli comes out of her reverie.
Do you think a person can be less than the sum of their parts?
I don’t think that’s a kind way to talk about Uncle David, Juli.
I wasn’t talking about Uncle David.
We were talking about Uncle David's annual visit.
Are we taking him to the Space Needle? The Bakers exchange looks -- where has she been?
Of course we’re taking him to the Space Needle. Juli stands up and walks over to the front window, looks at the lawn.
Do we have, like, clippers?
Juli is going down the aisle pushing a basket with her mother.
I was thinking that it wouldn’t be hard to fix up the front yard. It could be, you know, a project. A summer project.  flippedidmay21 58.
That’s a huge undertaking. Once I decided to alphabetize the books in my parents’ house and I didn’t even get through the B’s.
But it looks so bad.
It does? INT. JULI’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Juli is in bed, reading a book on landscaping. There’s a knock on the door. Trina and Robert open it.
Juli, did something happen? This revelation about our house --
Nothing, Daddy. Both parents sit on the bed. A beat.
Something happened.
The Loskis have been throwing my eggs away because our yard is so filthy they think they'll get salmonella if they eat them --
That is ridiculous --
Did Patsy say that?
They are such snobs.
Do you realize we’re the only people on this entire block who don’t have grass?  flippedidmay21 59.
Well, we used to have grass --
But then we had chickens --
So it’s my fault we don’t have grass? She bursts into tears.
Of course it’s not your fault, honey. Even when we had grass our yard was ...
Eccentric. We are eccentric.
I know, I know. Juli still weeping.
Oh, honey --
That silly woman with her DKNY purse. Trina looks over at him.
She’s not so bad. She helped me jump-start the car once --
Whatever.
Since when do you know about DKNY purses? He shrugs.
I keep up.
Not to mention that uptight father in those idiotic alligator shirts.  flippedidmay21 60. They both start to laugh. Even Juli is cheering up.
You really want to clean up the yard?
I do. It’1ll still be eccentric, I promise. (beat) They hate the Santa and the twinks too.
They hate twinkle lights? Oh, they are really sick.
So a couple of weeks later, summer vacation begins --
As Bryce and Garrett come bicycling down the street toget

And I’m coming home from buying a hundred pairs of socks for camp, and there she is -- Juli, dressed in jeans and an old shirt, is hacking away the shrubs in her yard. Bryce turns into his driveway and Garrett bikes on.
(talking to the shrubs as she hacks away) Out of there ... yes! ... you are coming off whether you like it or not ...

She’s cleaning up the yard. Like I didn’t feel bad enough for what I said but now she’s shoving my face in it... Bryce walks into his house, passing his grandfather on th front porch.  flippedidmay21 61. INT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM - A FEW MINUTES LATER He’s sitting at his computer, but he can hear her whackin and ranting.

And does she do it like anyone else, like a normal person? No, she’s talking to the shrubs -- He slams the window shut. INT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM - LATER He’s lying on his bed, reading a magazine. He can still h Juli through the window.
So then I find myself thinking, should I help her? Probably. I mean she’s all alone, it’s a pretty big job -- (continued) He gets up and walks over to the window ...

So I thought maybe I’d go out there, maybe I'd make it up to her by helping her cut back some bushes. Period. End of story. If she still wanted to be mad at me after that, fine. Her problem. (continued) INT/EXT. VIEW OUT BRYCE’S WINDOW - CONTINUOUS His grandfather is crossing the street to talk to Juli. H carrying some garden tools.

But I never got the chance. ON BRYCE AMAZED. INT/EXT VIEW OUT BRYCE’S WINDOW ... Julie and Chet. Chet takes garden gloves out of his back pocket, puts them on and together they tackle the hedges.  flippedidmay21 62.

There’s my grandpa doing my good deed. My grandpa. Who'd been parked on our front porch in a pair of bedroom slippers for six months, and now, thanks to Juli Baker, he’s in work boots. He’s walking. He’s talking. Had I ever seen him smile? The guy’s smiling. A series of shots: CHET AND JULI CUTTING BRANCHES.

head_text.subj: CHET AND JULI WRAPPING BRANCHES IN PLASTIC SO THEY CAN BE
JULI TELLING CHET SOMETHING. CHET LAUGHS.

text: All week long it went on. INT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM - DAY Bryce at his computer. The sound of whack, whack, whack. EXT. JULI’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS As Juli hammers nails into the fence, with Chet next to h EXT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM WINDOW - CONTINUOUS As Bryce goes to the window and looks out at the two of t
As Chet sees Bryce in the window, looking out at them. Ch waves at Bryce.

Hey, there -- Juli looks up, just in time to see: EXT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM WINDOW - CONTINUOUS As Bryce disappears out of sight, mortified.  flippedidmay21 63. EXT. BRYCE’S HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY A taxi pulls up. Bryce’s father RICK gets out with a suitcase and his golf clubs. He notices Chet and Juli working across the street. Walks into the house.
So now it’s my last night before camp, and my dad’s just gotten home from some conference about computer interfaces --
Dinner time. Rick, Patsy, Lynetta, Bryce and Chet. Chet i eating heartily.
Patsy, this is delicious.
Bryce’s favorite dinner. (to Bryce) Because you are not going to get food like this at camp.
You all packed?
Almost, almost.
So they basically broke us up into buzz groups but they kept changing the mix, so just when you thought you knew where you were, you weren’t --
How fascinating.
Boring.
That’s rude, Lynetta. Chet helps himself to another serving.  flippedidmay21 64.
(to Chet) So, Chet, I had no idea you were in the mood for a home improvement project. A beat. Bryce notices that Chet is pointedly ignoring his father.
Pass the salt, will you Patsy?
That was the first time I wondered, Maybe grandpa isn’t too crazy about Dad --
So why’s the girl the one who's finally doing something about their place? ON CHET, salting his potato, taking his time about it. He looks up at Bryce.
The big stare. Man oh man that freaked me out. Was Grandpa going to tell Dad about how I ragged Juli about the yard? ON CHET looking at Bryce, who’s now sweating. Then he loo at Rick.

She wants to, is all. Chet again looks over at Bryce and then goes back to eati Bryce, relieved, wipes his face with a napkin. INT. BRYCE’S BEDROOM - LATER In the bedroom is his camp trunk, about half-packed. His grandfather comes into the room. Bryce comes out of the closet, with some tee shirts to pa
Hey.  flippedidmay21 65.
(surprised) Hey. Chet sits down on Bryce’s bed.

Look, I know I messed up. I should have told her the truth about the eggs, and then she caught me tossing them out and I just lost it. (beat) Thanks for not saying anything at dinner. I owe you big time. His grandfather gets up, walks to the window, and looks o across the street.
She reminds me of your grandmother.
Juli? Bryce waits. Finally Chet turns around.
Your character is set at an early age, Bryce. The choices you make now will affect you for the rest of your life.
Yes, sir.
Don’t yes-sir me.
Sorry.
Here. Everyone needs a little money to get through camp. He hands Bryce some money. Bryce is stunned, looks at the money.
Thanks.  flippedidmay21 66.
The next time you’re faced with a choice, do the right thing. It hurts everyone less in the long run. He leaves.
Bryce and his dad carry his trunk out to their SUV. They it into the back of the car. Bryce looks up at Juli’s window. She’s not there.

Robert drives his truck past the place where the sycamore tree used to be. There’s a man in the front seat of the truck with him -- his brother DAVID, 41, who has Asberger syndrome. We see David look over at the house going up on the property.
Juli is seeding the lawn in front of the house as Robert pulls into the driveway and he and Uncle David get out.
Hi Juli --
Uncle David --
Your tree’s gone. You were sad. Uncle David gives her a sweet, awkward hug.
The Baker family eats a barbecue dinner outdoors with Unc David. Uncle David is counting his baked beans.  flippedidmay21 67.
The Baker family, including Uncle David, going up in the Space Needle elevator. Uncle David is compulsively counti floors.
Juli and Chet are planting tulip bulbs in the garden. Dav counts them. Mrs. Stueby turns up from next door with a t of lemonade for everyone and a big smile for Chet.
Robert, Juli and David approaching the corner where the sycamore tree used to be.
Don’t drive past where the tree was.
As the truck makes a left turn to avoid going past the intersection.
Juli and Robert drop Uncle David back at the sanitorium w he lives. Everyone gives him hugs goodbye.
Too bad about your tree, Juli.
Thanks, Uncle David.
We see Juli through her window.  flippedidmay21 68. INT. JULI’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Juli in bed, reading. A knock on her door. Her father pee in...
Hi.
Hi, Dad. He sits on the edge of her bed.
I always liked that tree of yours, even before you told me about it.
Dad, it’s okay, I'll get over it.

No, it’s not okay, and you don’t have to get over it. Listen to me, just listen -- (beat) I want the spirit of that tree to be with you always. I want you to remember how you felt when you were up there and the whole world sparkled. (beat) My brave daughter looking out at the world from the very top --
It was so beautiful, and now it’s as if it wasn’t even there --
